intro: Eryngiophyllum pinnatisectum, commonly known as the narrow-leaved eryngiophyllum, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and vegetables. The plant is characterized by its finely divided, pinnatisected leaves that give it a feathery appearance. Its flowers are small and clustered in umbels, typical of the Apiaceae family. It is often found in rocky or gravelly soils and is adapted to harsh, high-altitude environments.
